results.title: Metformin and Its Immune-Mediated Effects in Various Diseases
results.text_hl: Next, we further review the emerging roles of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, i.e., immune-mediated beneficial effects, in various diseases such as @<m>DISEASE_Virus_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014777 @@@virus infection@@@, @DISEASE_Autoimmune_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D001327 @@@autoimmune diseases@@@, aging and @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@cancers@@@.

results.title: Mechanisms and Therapeutic Strategies of Viral Myocarditis Targeting Autophagy
results.text_hl: Finally, this review also examined and assessed the use of several popular autophagy modulating drugs, such as @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Resveratrol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077185 @@@resveratrol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Sirolimus @CHEMICAL_MESH:D020123 @@@rapamycin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Wortmannin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077191 @@@wortmannin@@@, and @CHEMICAL_3_methyladenine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C025946 @@@3-methyladenine@@@, as alternative treatment strategies for @<m>DISEASE_Virus_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014777 @@@viral myocarditis@@@.

results.title: Metformin in Antiviral Therapy: Evidence and Perspectives.
results.text_hl: This multifaceted approach highlights @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@'s potential as an adjunctive therapy in treating a wide range of @<m>DISEASE_Virus_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014777 @@@viral infections@@@.

results.title: Metformin turns 62 in pharmacotherapy: Emergence of non-glycaemic effects and potential novel therapeutic applications.
results.text_hl: Anti-@DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ and antioxidant effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ seem to qualify it as an adjunct therapy in treating @DISEASE_Communicable_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D003141 @@@infectious diseases@@@ such as @DISEASE_Tuberculosis @DISEASE_MESH:D014376 @@@tuberculosis@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Virus_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014777 @@@viral hepatitis@@@, and the current novel @DISEASE_COVID_19 @DISEASE_MESH:D000086382 @@@Covid-19 infections@@@.

results.title: Targeting T cell (oxidative) metabolism to improve immunity to viral infection in the context of obesity
results.text_hl: To that end, several recent studies have shown that use of the metabolic drug, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, can reverse abnormal T cell metabolism and restore T cell immunity, as well as survival, in response to @<m>DISEASE_Virus_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014777 @@@viral infection@@@.

results.title: Metformin restrains ZIKV replication and alleviates virus-induced inflammatory responses in microglia.
results.text_hl: Recent studies suggest that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, an established treatment for @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes@@@ may play a role in @<m>DISEASE_Virus_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014777 @@@viral infection@@@; however, little is known about the interactions between @DISEASE_Zika_Virus_Infection @DISEASE_MESH:D000071243 @@@ZIKV infection@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ administration.

results.title: [Metformin: one of the possible options to reduce the mortality of severe coronavirus disease 2019?]
results.journal: Zhonghua Wei Zhong Bing Ji Jiu Yi Xue
results.text_hl: Host-directed therapy (HDT) is an emerging therapeutic method in the field of anti-@DISEASE_Infections @DISEASE_MESH:D007239 @@@infection@@@, which can activate the self-protective immune response, suppress excessive @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ response, and be used to assist the treatment of traditional drugs to shorten the course of disease. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ has been shown to be effective in HDT and can assist in the treatment of the @<m>DISEASE_Virus_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014777 @@@viral@@@ and @DISEASE_Bacterial_Infections @DISEASE_MESH:D001424 @@@bacterial@@@ @DISEASE_Communicable_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D003141 @@@infectious disease@@@.

citations.NLM: Pan Y, Han R, He Y. [Metformin: one of the possible options to reduce the mortality of severe coronavirus disease 2019?] Zhonghua Wei Zhong Bing Ji Jiu Yi Xue. 2020 Sep;32(9):1131-1134. PMID: 33081905
